title: GitLab
descriptionMarkdown: The [GitLab](https://about.gitlab.com/solutions/devops-platform/) connector allows you to easily connect your GitLab (GitLab Enterprise Edition - Standalone) logs with Microsoft Sentinel. This gives you more security insight into your organization's DevOps pipelines.
additionalRequirementBanner: This data connector depends on three parsers based on a Kusto Function to work as expected [**GitLab Access Logs**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-GitLabAccess-parser), [**GitLab Audit Logs**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-GitLabAudit-parser) and [**GitLab Application Logs**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-GitLabApp-parser) which are deployed with the Microsoft Sentinel Solution.

dataTypes.name: Syslog (GitlabAccess)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
GitLabAccess
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: Syslog (GitlabAudit)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
GitLabAudit
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: Syslog (GitlabApp)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
GitLabApp
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
GitLabApp
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

GitLabAudit
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

GitLabAccess
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

instructionSteps.title: Configuration
instructionSteps.description: >This data connector depends on three parsers based on a Kusto Function to work as expected [**GitLab Access Logs**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-GitLabAccess-parser), [**GitLab Audit Logs**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-GitLabAudit-parser) and [**GitLab Application Logs**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-GitLabApp-parser) which are deployed with the Microsoft Sentinel Solution.

instructionSteps.title: 1. Install and onboard the agent for Linux
instructionSteps.description:
Typically, you should install the agent on a different computer from the one on which the logs are generated.

>  Syslog logs are collected only from **Linux** agents.

parameters.title: Choose where to install the agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Linux Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Linux Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure the logs to be collected
instructionSteps.description:
Configure the facilities you want to collect and their severities.

1.  Under workspace advanced settings **Configuration**, select **Data** and then **Syslog**.
2.  Select **Apply below configuration to my machines** and select the facilities and severities.
3.  Click **Save**.
